text: == Events == * Mongol leader Ghazan Khan is converted to Islam, ending a line of Tantric Buddhist leaders. * Philip IV of France and Pope Boniface VIII begin having disagreements. * Jayavarman VIII of the Khmer Empire in Cambodia abdicates. * Marco Polo returns to Italy from his travels to China. * Edward I summons the Model Parliament. == Births == * September 16 – Elizabeth de Clare, English noblewoman (died 1360) * John IV, Duke of Brittany (died 1345) * Eudes IV, Duke of Burgundy (died 1350) * Reginald de Cobham, 1st Baron Cobham (died 1361) * Joanna of Flanders, military leader in the Breton War of Succession (approximate date; died 1374) * Nicephorus Gregoras, Byzantine historian (approximate date; died 1360) * Al-Nasr Muhammad, sultan of Egypt (died 1341) * Saint Roch (approximate date; died 1327) == Deaths == * April 25 – King Sancho IV of Castile (born 1257) * August 12 – Charles Martel d'Anjou (born 1271) * December 7 – Gilbert de Clare, 7th Earl of Hertford, English politician (b. 1243) * December 21 – Marguerite Berenger of Provence, queen of Louis IX of France (born c. 1221) * Meinhard II of Gorizia-Tyrol (born 1238)
